ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
Python wheels are great. Building them across Mac, Linux, Windows,
on multiple versions of Python, is not.
cibuildwheel is here to help. cibuildwheel runs on your CI server -
currently it supports GitHub Actions, Azure Pipelines, Travis CI,
AppVeyor, CircleCI, and GitLab CI - and it builds and tests your
wheels across all of your platforms.
about.summary: Building wheels across Mac, Linux, Windows, on multiple versions of Python.

script: export SP_DIR=$(python -c 'import sysconfig; print(sysconfig.get_paths()["purelib"])') && mkdir -p $SP_DIR/patchelf && mkdir -p $SP_DIR/patchelf-0.0.0.dist-info && echo -e "Metadata-Version: 2.1\nName: patchelf\nVersion: 0.0.0" > $SP_DIR/patchelf-0.0.0.dist-info/METADATA

about.description:
Python wheels are great. Building them across Mac, Linux, Windows,
on multiple versions of Python, is not.
cibuildwheel is here to help. cibuildwheel runs on your CI server -
currently it supports GitHub Actions, Azure Pipelines, Travis CI,
AppVeyor, CircleCI, and GitLab CI - and it builds and tests your
wheels across all of your platforms.
about.summary: Building wheels across Mac, Linux, Windows, on multiple versions of Python.

script: export SP_DIR=$(python -c 'import sysconfig; print(sysconfig.get_paths()["purelib"])') && mkdir -p $SP_DIR/patchelf && mkdir -p $SP_DIR/patchelf-0.0.0.dist-info && echo -e "Metadata-Version: 2.1\nName: patchelf\nVersion: 0.0.0" > $SP_DIR/patchelf-0.0.0.dist-info/METADATA

name: cibuildwheel
raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  python_min: "3.11"
  name: cibuildwheel
  version: "3.3.1"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/pypa/cibuildwheel/archive/refs/tags/v${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 62024aef665e36a5af2c2805790f2d0e10d8ef46614d9e2bbc8f39b938957300

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  python:
    entry_points:
      - cibuildwheel = cibuildwheel.__main__:main

requirements:
  host:
    - hatchling
    - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=${{ python_min }}
    - bashlex
    - bracex
    - certifi
    - dependency-groups
    - filelock
    - humanize
    - packaging
    - patchelf
    - platformdirs
    - pyelftools
    - python-build
    - wheel

tests:
  - files:
      source:
        - test/
    requirements:
      run:
        - pip
        - jinja2
        - pytest >=6
        - pytest-timeout
        - pytest-xdist
        - python-build
        - validate-pyproject
        - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    script:
      # Create dummy patchelf package for pip check
      - >
        export SP_DIR=$(python -c 'import sysconfig; print(sysconfig.get_paths()["purelib"])') &&
        mkdir -p $SP_DIR/patchelf &&
        mkdir -p $SP_DIR/patchelf-0.0.0.dist-info &&
        echo -e "Metadata-Version: 2.1\nName: patchelf\nVersion: 0.0.0" > $SP_DIR/patchelf-0.0.0.dist-info/METADATA
      - pip check
      - cibuildwheel --help
      - pytest test/test_dependency_versions.py
      - pytest test/test_emulation.py
      - pytest test/test_macos_archs.py
      - pytest test/test_wheel_tag.py
      - pytest test/test_windows.py
  - python:
      imports:
        - cibuildwheel
      python_version: ${{ python_min }}.*
      pip_check: false

about:
  summary: Building wheels across Mac, Linux, Windows, on multiple versions of Python.
  description: |
    Python wheels are great. Building them across Mac, Linux, Windows,
    on multiple versions of Python, is not.
    cibuildwheel is here to help. cibuildwheel runs on your CI server -
    currently it supports GitHub Actions, Azure Pipelines, Travis CI,
    AppVeyor, CircleCI, and GitLab CI - and it builds and tests your
    wheels across all of your platforms.
  license: BSD-2-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE
  homepage: https://github.com/pypa/cibuildwheel
  documentation: https://cibuildwheel.pypa.io/en/stable/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - henryiii
    - MementoRC
